movies_data_cleaning.clean_genre(frame, orig_col, new_col)¶

Creates a new genre column to the Dataframe that extracts the first genre for each movie from raw movie file. Original genre column was a dictionary coerced into string.

Args:
frame (DataFrame): movie DataFrame with raw genre orig_col (str): name of existing genre column new_col (str): name of new genre column
Returns:
Dataframe with new genre column
movies_data_cleaning.conv_to_numeric(frame)¶

Converts continuous variables from string to integer.

movies_data_cleaning.drop_columns(frame, col_list)¶

Removes unwanted columns from the data frame.

movies_data_cleaning.get_data(ext, file_name)¶

Reads the movie data file into a pandas DataFrame.

movies_data_cleaning.get_release_year(frame)¶

Creates a new column that extracts the release year for each movie.

movies_data_cleaning.make_genre_dummy(frame, genre_col)¶

Creates DataFrame with dummy variables for each genre.

movies_data_cleaning.merge_dummies(frame1, frame2)¶

Merges movies DataFrame with movie genre dummies Dataframe.

movies_data_cleaning.release_timespan(frame)¶

Calculates time between current year and release year of movie.

movies_data_cleaning.remove_empty(frame)¶

Removes observations with N/As or zeroes.

movies_data_cleaning.scale_pop(frame, orig_col, new_col)¶

Takes log transformation of a numeric column in dataframe.

movies_data_cleaning.shift_pop(frame)¶

Converts all zeroes in the popularity column to 1.
